While mummy guardians are undead crafted from the corpses of sacrificed— usually unwilling victims—and retain only fragments of their memories, a mummy pharaoh is the result of a deliberate embrace of undeath by a sadistic and cruel ruler. The transformation from life to undeath beneath the scorching desert sand is only somewhat less awful, but as the transition is an intentional bid to escape death by a powerful personality who fully embraces the blasphemous repercussions of the choice, the mummy pharaoh retains its memories and personality intact. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 31 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 29 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26 [Mummy Pharaoh](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3102) **Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 235 1.1 **Perception** +20; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20); plus any two languages they knew while alive **Skills** [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +18, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +20, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +15, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +20, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +13 **Str** +5 **Dex** +2 **Con** +4 **Int** +0 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +5 **Rejuvenation** ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579)) When a mummy pharaoh is destroyed, necromantic energies rebuild its body in its tomb over 1d10 days. If the body is destroyed during that time, the process starts anew. A reforming mummy pharaoh is destroyed permanently if their tomb is [_consecrated_](/Rituals.aspx?ID=115). **Items** _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2829) [longspear](/Weapons.aspx?ID=361)_ --- **AC** 27 **Fort** +19 **Ref** +15 **Will** +20 +1 status to all saves vs. [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509) **HP** 175 (sacred wrappings, [void healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=83)) **Immunities** bleed, [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) **Weaknesses** [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 10, [water](/Traits.aspx?ID=732) 10 **Undead Mastery** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579)) 100 feet. Commanded or allied [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=722) in the aura that have a lower level than the mummy pharaoh gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, AC, saves, and skill checks.
**[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** The mummy pharaoh can use Reactive Strike when a creature within its reach uses a [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=561) action, in addition to its normal trigger. It can disrupt triggering concentrate actions, and it disrupts actions on any hit, not just a critical hit.
**Sacred Wrappings** ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579)) When a creature deals physical damage to the pharaoh or triggers one of the pharaoh's weaknesses, it must succeed at a DC 28 Will save or become [doomed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=67). Regardless of the results of the save, the creature is then immune to that mummy's sacred wrappings for 24 hours. --- **Speed** 20 feet **Melee** _longspear_ +21 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d8+11 piercing plus 1d6 void **Melee** fist +20 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 1d10+11 bludgeoning plus 1d6 void **Sandstorm Wrath** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55), [Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72)) The mummy pharaoh exhales a 60-foot cone of superheated sand that deals 5d6 fire and 5d6 slashing damage (DC 28 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). The mummy pharaoh can't use Sandstorm Wrath again for 1d4 rounds. **Veil of Sand** ([Aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55)) Sand whirls around the mummy pharaoh in a 5-foot emanation until the beginning of their next turn. Creatures inside the sand are [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62) to those outside it and any living creature ending its turn within the sand takes 4d6 slashing damage with a DC 28 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save. Veil of Sand ends if the mummy takes damage from their water weakness.
